title: There wonâ€™t be a brawl at the Olympics â€” No fighting allowed
description: Tensions will be high and the hockey will be fast, but the gloves are staying on.
fullText:
February 15th, 2025, American brothers Matthew and Brady Tkachuk sent a message, and in the days that followed, we learned more and more details about what led to that event, but none of that was as vivid as what we witnessed upon puck drop.

Three fights in the first nine seconds of the game were fueled by political and geographical tension. It was an exercise in why sanctioned sport is healthy for the world, as both sides were able to express their dissatisfaction by hurling fists at each other.

It was a moment that set the sports world on fire.

The Canadiens got the last swing and landed the knockout blow by winning the Four Nations tournament in an American barn. Now itâ€™s time for the first NHL-attended Olympics since 2012.

THREE FIGHTS. NINE SECONDS APART TO START THE GAME.

THE CANADA VS. USA RIVALRY HAS NEVER BEEN MORE ALIVE ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ğŸ”¥ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ pic.twitter.com/aYK9TAs5PD

â€” Gino Hard (@GinoHard_) February 16, 2025

As we approach the Menâ€™s Ice Hockey tournament of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, we have to wonder what animosity remains, and could there be more group text plotting?

"Maybe their team doesn't like each other then if they don't have group chatsâ€¦ Our team doesn't care about anything that they say." ğŸ‘€

Matthew Tkachuk responds to Brandon Hagel's comments about playing for the flag. #4Nations pic.twitter.com/GdrpivoUVi

â€” Sportsnet (@Sportsnet) February 19, 2025

No matter whatâ€™s being said, I donâ€™t think anyone will be fighting at the Olympics with the IIHFâ€™s rigid rules against doing so.

Fighting in the Olympics is strictly prohibited, and doing so will likely result in an immediate ejection and potential suspension for those involved. Or as the official IIHF rules state:

That doesnâ€™t take it entirely off the table, but I highly doubt anyone is willing to risk suspension from the first games involving NHL players in over 10 years. It feels like there is just too much to lose in this tournament.

After 12 years, the NHL's biggest stars are finally back on the Olympic stage. ğŸ’

Here's what it means to some of the players ready to make history. âœ¨ pic.twitter.com/IPVYJ7YEmS

â€” The Olympic Games (@Olympics) February 5, 2026

We know Matthew Tkachuk has his eyes on the prize after this quote in a Sports Illustrated article by Pat Forde, â€œIâ€™ve had two dreams in my professional lifeâ€”win a Stanley Cup and win an Olympic gold medal. Iâ€™ve got the first.â€

Former Team Canada focal point Rick Nash told FOX News, â€œAs a player, I can guarantee you, the only thing on your mind is a gold medal. You donâ€™t care if itâ€™s Norway, Latvia, the US, or whoever.â€

We might not see the staged fights, but one thing is for certain.

This hockey tournament is going to be a grueling physical battle, and they will only play one anthem when itâ€™s time to hand out the hardware.

That moment will feature copious amounts of glory and pride, but standing on the silver or bronze level could be an unforgettable but painful memory. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™m speaking out of turn when I say itâ€™s gold or nothing for these competitors. Thatâ€™s just how they are wired.

Which superstar between Connor McDavid and Nathan MacKinnon would best partner with Macklin Celebrini at the Winter Olympic Games? 

The Leafs on TSN panel discuss these topics and 

Video: https://t.co/W4789OjgHM pic.twitter.com/ouqfap5qQ7

â€” TSN (@TSN_Sports) January 25, 2026

title: CeeDee Lamb feels comfortable speaking out about what he wants to see from the Cowboys
description: CeeDee Lamb feels comfortable advocating for what he wants to see from the Cowboys
fullText:
CeeDee Lamb has gotten the question a lot this week. The George Pickens contract situation is on the top of everybodyâ€™s minds when it comes to matters concerning the Dallas Cowboys, and given that Lamb is close with Pickens, it makes sense for him to address it.

When it comes to situations like these some players offer a party line. They note that the business of football is what it is and that they trust their front office to take care of what is in the best interest of the team. Lamb has hardly stepped a toe out of line on the Pickens front, but he has not been shy. He wants Pickens back and even said he would be fine if Pickens out-earns him on a hypothetical new deal.

Those who have followed Lamb, whether at Oklahoma or in the six seasons that he has been in Dallas, know that he is hardly boisterous. He is not brash. He is hardly stirring the pot with his Pickens comments, but his advocacy is a further step out than we have seen him take normally (he certainly campaigned for Micah Parsons and Dak Prescott to get compensated when they were dealing with the team).

Lamb made an appearance on Saturday at Super Bowl LX to discuss how he treated an Air Force veteran to a trip to see the game of all games and I asked him when he felt comfortable speaking up about things he wants to see the team do.

Dallas Cowboys WR CeeDee Lamb has been outspoken about wanting George Pickens back this offseason. 

I was curious when he felt confident enough to vocalize his wants about decisions like that with respect to the team and front office at large. pic.twitter.com/rGXzHxIfTq

â€” RJ Ochoa (@rjochoa) February 7, 2026

Lamb noted that he has always had the availability to advocate in this sense so that particular part of things is nothing new, but he did add that he feels comfortable in his space.

It has been interesting in the time that the Cowboys have developed their approach to contract extensions to see how player advocacy has evolved with that. To start this week Dak Prescott also noted that he would â€œget involvedâ€ if he had to in the Pickens situation. Nobody wants to read too much into any one comment from any player, but they appear to be utilizing their own platforms to state their wants and wishes. It is interesting to see.

title: The Chicago Bearsâ€™ Super Bowl Window is Open
description: The 2025 season was incredible for the Chicago Beras, but itâ€™s just the beginning. @wiltfongjr on whatâ€™s to come.
fullText:
No one was expecting year one of the Ben Johnson era to end in a Super Bowl for the Chicago Bears, but the 2025 season went better than most fans could have expected. But even so, it felt like it ended too soon. The loss in the NFC Divisional Round against the Los Angeles Rams stung because they had worked their magic again, battling back to tie the game with just 19 seconds left.

A Rams three-and-out to start the overtime period, and the Bears were in position to win.

The end was disappointing, but the season truly felt like the start of something special, and 89% of of fans feel the Super Bowl window is open.

Ben Johnson changed the trajectory of the franchise.

His partnership with Caleb Williams had a rough start, by design, and it got better and better as the year wore on.

Chicago finished ninth in points scored and sixth in total offensive yards. The Bearsâ€™ top-ten finish in those two categories has occurred only three other times since 1985.

Including his three years as offensive coordinator in Detroit, Johnsonâ€™s offense has never been out of the top ten in either of those two categories.

The arrow is pointing up on the offense, and if the Bears attack the defense this offseason as they attacked the offense last year, that side of the ball will more than hold its own in 2026.

Our partners at FanDuel Sportsbook have the Bears odds to win next yearâ€™s Super Bowl at +2700.

The window may be open, but Johnson wonâ€™t take it for granted.

â€œThere is no building off of this,â€ Johnson said at the end of the season press conference. â€œWe go back to square one. Weâ€™re back at the bottom again.â€

This is SB Nation Reacts, a survey of fans across the NFL. Throughout the year, weâ€™ll ask questions of the most plugged-in Chicago Bears fans and fans across the country.

title: This Week In Lazio History: February 2-8
description: Today we remember wins against Milan and Inter, a controversial draw with Juventus, ridiculous refereeing in a match against Bari, and the tragic death of Fantoni IIMatches of the WeekDate: Sunday, Fe...
fullText:
Today we remember wins against Milan and Inter, a controversial draw with Juventus, ridiculous refereeing in a match against Bari, and the tragic death of Fantoni II

Date: Sunday, February 3, 1957 Venue: Stadio Comunale, Turin Fixture: Juventus Lazio 3-3 Lazio denied win in Turin by dubious penalty and a controversially disallowed winner

Date: Sunday, February 3, 1974 Venue: Stadio Olimpico, Rome Fixture: Lazio Vicenza 3-0 A 3-0 which does not tell the full extent of Lazioâ€™s superiority. Goals from Chinaglia and Garlaschelli

Date: Sunday, February 5, 2017 Venue: Stadio Adriatico, Pescara Fixture: Pescara Lazio 2-6 Marco Parolo scores four as Lazio demolish Pescara.

Date: Thursday, February 5, 2004

Venue: Stadio Giuseppe Meazza, Milan Fixture: Milan Lazio 1-2, Coppa Italia Semi Final, First Leg Lazio go two goals up and then survive Milan comeback to take lead into second leg

Date: Sunday, February 6, 1994 Venue: Stadio Giuseppe Meazza, Milan Fixture: Inter Lazio 1-2 Lazio went from one down to 2-1 up in three minutes as Signori and Di Matteo turned the game around in the dying moments

Date: Sunday, February 4, 1996 Venue: Stadio Olimpico, Rome Fixture: Lazio Bari 4-3

Lazio started the match very well and soon after kick-off Pierluigi Casiraghi hit the woodwork. The Biancocelesti were dominating but Bari scored in the 9th minute. Kennet Andersson headed the ball to Carmine Gautieri who beat the Lazio defence for speed and was supposedly fouled by Luca Marchegiani in the penalty box. Supposedly, because there were big doubts. But the referee, Daniele Tombolini, decided it was a penalty and Igor Protti made no mistake.

The ref must have thought he had made a wrong call because he then opted to compensate with a ridiculous decision: in the 22nd minute Francesco Pedone touched Alen Boksic who went flying to the ground. Penalty for Lazio, Beppe Signori scored. 1-1 but two wrongs certainly do not make a right, Mr. Tombolini.

Four minutes later penalty number three. This time it was a clear foul with Marcello Montanari tripping Aron Winter. Signori made it 2-1.

Lazio took control of the match and Boksic was unstoppable. The Croatian had a chance in the 30th minute but it was saved by Fontana. The ball got to Winter who passed it to Signori. 3-1 for Lazio. With these three goals Signori overtook Giorgio Chinaglia and became Lazioâ€™s second highest scorer in Serie A, behind Silvio Piola.

In the second half Bari manager Eugenio Fascetti realized that there was a need to speed things up a bit and make more use of Andersson and this is exactly what happened in the 64th minute. Gautieri had no problem in beating Dario Marcolin on the right and crossed for the big Swede. The ball went over Marchegianiâ€™s head and Andersson headed the ball in comfortably.

At the one end, there was Gautieri unstoppable on the right while Protti was driving Alessandro Nesta nuts and all the crosses were Anderssonâ€™s. At the other end Boksic, Casiraghi and Signori were creating havoc in the Bari penalty box.

Andersson had a chance via a free kick but it was well saved by the Lazio goalkeeper. Boksic dribbled past a number of Bari players and passed to Casiraghi who hit the woodwork. In the 78th minute the Croatian decided to go solo and made it 4-2 for Lazio.

Tombolini, who was a bit upset that he was no longer the protagonist of the match, decided it was time for another penalty. So in the 81st minute Protti scored his second goal. No idea on why the ref decided it was a penalty.

The refereeâ€™s masterpiece however came with one minute to go. Casiraghi, unmarked, thirty metres from the goal with the Bari goalkeeper outside the penalty box, decided to shoot. Fontana clearly saved it with his hands. The referee whistled. Foul. Everybody was expecting a red card but Fontana claimed the ball hit his leg, Casiraghi confirmed it, so the ref decided on a dropped-ball.

Lazio managed to keep the slim lead and win a very difficult match. Tombolini should have seriously considered giving up refereeing.

Today we remember the tragic death of Octavio Fantoni II.

He was born in Belo Horizonte, on April 4, 1907. In Brazil he played for Palestra ItÃ¡lia (the club now owned by Ronaldo). He won two Mineiro titles with â€œA Raposaâ€ (The Fox) and in 1930 he was signed by Lazio along with one of his cousins, JoÄo Fantoni I. He became known as Ottavio.

In Rome he immediately made it into the first team squad. In 1930-31 the manager was first Ferenc MolnÃ¡r, then Cesare Migliorini and finally AmÃ­lcar. Lazio finished 8th and Ottavio played 10 league games. Lazioâ€™s best results were beating Ambrosiana Inter 1-0 and Juventus 2-1 both at home while both derbies ended up in draws.

In 1931-32 Lazio finished 13th under player-manager AmÃ­lcar. Ottavio played more regularly making 28 league appearances with 2 goals (Triestina and the winner against Fiorentina). Lazioâ€™s best result was a 2-1 away win at Juventus while both derbies were lost.

In 1932-33 the manager was Austrian Karl StÃ¼rmer and Lazio finished 10th. Ottavio played 26 league games with 1 goal (Pro Patria). He was also joined by another of the cousins, LeonÃ­zio Fantoni III. Lazioâ€™s best results were beating Inter 2-1 in Milan, the first derby 2-1, Alessandria 6-0, Juventus 1-0 and Milan 2-0 all at home.

In 1933-34 StÃ¼rmer stayed on and Lazio came in 10th again. Ottavio Played 31 league games with 1 goal (Casale in 2-1 win). The highlight was a 4-0 home win over Milan while Lazio lost the first derby and drew the second 3-3 after being 0-3 down.

In 1934-35 Czech manager Walter Alt arrived at Lazio. A certain Silvio Piola also arrived from Pro Vercelli. It would however be a tragic year for Lazio and Ottavio Fantoni in particular. On January 20, in a home game against Torino, he wounded his nose. He was forced off but came back on five minutes later and even contributed to Silvio Piolaâ€™s equaliser. It did not seem anything too serious but then it got infected and he was hospitalised with a high fever and a knee full of pus; two weeks later he was dead. An awful tragedy. He was only 27 and left two daughters of eight and seven who had already lost their mother.

In his last tragic season Ottavio had played 13 league games with 1 goal (Fiorentina). Lazio finished a positive 5th beating Juventus 5-3 and drawing both derbies.

Fantoniâ€™s premature death is one of many sad stories in Lazioâ€™s history.

Ottavio Fantoni also played for Italy, thanks to his Tuscan origins (his parents were from Arezzo). He won one cap against Greece, on March 24,1934, in a 4-0 victory.

The Fantoni legacy is an important one at Lazio. Ottavio played 109 games with 4 goals, JoÄo 113 with 38 goals, LeonÃ­zio 25 with 9 goals and some years later Orlando 8 with 2 goals.

Ottavio Fantoni was an extremely popular player at Lazio. He was a midfielder who combined quantity and quality. He was elegant, technical but also incredibly hard working. The fans loved him for his fighting spirit.

In Brazil he was known as Nininho while in Italy as mentioned he became Ottavio. He was known as Fantoni II because he had three cousins who were also footballers.

Elseid Hysaj, 2/2/1994, defender, Albania, 130 appearances, 2 goals (2021-ongoing)

Ravel Morrison, 2/2/1993, midfielder, UK, 8 appearances (2015-16)

Giuseppe Papadopulo, 2/2/1948, defender, Italy, 90 appearances (1969-72, manager 2005)

Giancarlo Morrone, 5/2/1941, forward/midfielder, Argentina, 269 appearances, 53 goals (1960-64, 1966-71, manager 1984)

Fisayo Dele-Bashiru, 6/2/2001, midfielder, Nigeria, 41 appearances, 5 goals (2024-ongoing)

Dario Pighin, 6/2/1951, defender, Italy, 106 appearances (1976-82)

Valon Berisha, 7/2/1993, midfielder, Norway, 22 appearances (2018-20)

Federico Marchetti, 7/2/1983, goalkeeper, Italy, 194 appearances (2011-18)

Ousmane Dabo, 8/2/1977, midfielder, France, 155 appearances, 4 goals (2003-06, 2008-10)

Massimo De Stefanis, 8/2/1957, midfielder, 8 appearances, 1 goal (1977-79)

This Article Was Written by Dag Jenkins & Simon Basten from Lazio Stories. More Information on the Above Matches and Players can be found on LazioStories.com.

title: Why Tom Brady was confused with Scottie Scheffler preferring to be a â€˜better fatherâ€™ than golfer
description: Tom Brady once found himself puzzled by a debate that resurfaced well beyond the football field. In July 2025, the seven-time Super Bowl champion addressed comments made by golf star Scottie Scheffler about family and professional priorities, offering a perspective shaped by his own career.
fullText:
Tom Brady once found himself puzzled by a debate that resurfaced well beyond the football field.

In July 2025, the seven-time Super Bowl champion addressed comments made by golf star Scottie Scheffler about family and professional priorities, offering a perspective shaped by his own career.

Brady shared his reaction in a personal reflection published on TomBrady.com, responding to the idea that being an elite athlete and a devoted family man sit in opposition.

He said, â€œScottie said heâ€™d rather be a better father and husband than a good golfer. And my question is: why are those mutually exclusive? Sure, theyâ€™re different blocks on the pyramid, but theyâ€™re part of the same pyramid.

â€œTheyâ€™re connected! For instance, I think part of being a great father is being a great example of doing what it takes to take care of your family. I chose to do it by playing football,â€ Brady added.

At the time, Bradyâ€™s comments stood out because they challenged a growing narrative around elite sport and sacrifice.

Rather than rejecting family-first values, Brady reframed the discussion. In his view, professional excellence and personal responsibility are intertwined rather than competing priorities.

The tone of the response reflected where Brady was in life then, nearing the end of his playing career and increasingly reflective about his legacy.

Brady expanded on his thinking by explaining how his relentless commitment to football fit into his definition of being present for his family.

â€œMy dedication to the sport, the hours of practice, the moments when I was laser focused, those were times when I believe I was doing the best possible thing for my family and my kids.

â€œBy prioritizing my profession and teaching, by example, what it takes to be really good at your job, what it takes to follow through on commitments, what it takes to be a great teammate; and showing them, also by example, that work is a big part of all of our lives,â€ Brady added.

The comments offered insight into how Brady justified the demands of a two-decade career.

He viewed discipline, preparation, and consistency not as absences from family life, but as lessons delivered through action.

Looking back, the exchange captured a philosophical divide rather than a disagreement. Both perspectives valued family, but differed on how professional ambition fits into that picture.

As a throwback moment, Bradyâ€™s response now reads as a snapshot of an athlete grappling with balance while still defending the path he chose.

It remains a reminder that conversations about success and family are rarely simple, even among the most accomplished figures in sport.

title: How many Super Bowl rings does Tom Brady have?
description: Letâ€™s take a look at Tom Bradyâ€™s history in Super Bowl play as his former team, the New England Patriots, prepare to play in Super Bowl LX.
fullText:
The New England Patriots are back in the Super Bowl for the first time since 2018, when three-time AP NFL MVP quarterback Tom Brady led them to a victory at Super Bowl LIII.

The Patriots are led by a new quarterback this season â€” AP NFL MVP finalist Drake Maye. Nevertheless, Bradyâ€™s lasting impact with the team over the course of his 20-year career in New England has consistently been brought to remembrance ahead of the Super Bowl on February 8.

A win for Maye at Super Bowl LX will make him the second starting quarterback aside from Brady to win a championship for New England, which would draw comparisons to the former franchise great.

Letâ€™s take a look at Bradyâ€™s history in Super Bowl appearances:

Tom Brady is a seven-time Super Bowl champion.

Brady won the Super Bowl six times (2001, 2003-04, â€˜14, â€˜16, â€˜18) for the New England Patriots. The Michigan product won his seventh Super Bowl for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in 2020 â€” his first season with the franchise.

Brady owns a 7-3 record across 10 Super Bowl appearances.

The three-time first-team All-Pro quarterback's three losses in the big game came against the New York Giants (2007, â€˜11), followed by the Philadelphia Eagles (2017).

Brady won the Super Bowl MVP five times in his career. He won four times with New England (2001, â€˜03, â€˜14, â€˜16), as well as with Tampa Bay (2020) once.

Follow Patriots Wire onÂ TwitterÂ andÂ Facebook.

This article originally appeared on Patriots Wire: How many Super Bowl rings does Tom Brady have?

title: Golfweek 50th anniversary memories: Longtime editor Kevin Adams
description: We continue the series with a longtime editor, Kevin Adams.
fullText:
As part of the fun surrounding our 50th anniversary, Golfweek has been walking down Memory Lane with a number of former employees who helped make the brand what it is today.

We continue the series with a longtime editor, Kevin Adams.

Senior Marketing Editorial Manager, Holland & Knight LLP

I was more on the editing side, so I didn't get to write too often at Golfweek, but I was most proud of some of my travel writing, including features that I wrote on a Hawaii golf cruise, Pinehurst, Daufuskie Island, Hilton Head and a spring training-golf combo trip in South Florida. Travel editors Jeff Barr and Marty Kaufmann graciously afforded me the opportunity to go on such trips, and I still feel those were some of the best articles in my sports journalism career of nearly 25 years.

Every Sunday night and Monday during a major week, which was a blur from the end of Sunday's final round until the magazine was completed the evening after. We'd always have a ton of extra pages to fill, with very little copy coming in before late Sunday evening. We typically left at midnight or after, then were back at 8 a.m. on Monday morning to start editing the stories turned in overnight and then reviewing each page as it was completed, often not leaving the office until the last page was done at 8 or 9 p.m. (or later). Looking back, I'm not sure how we did it, but having a terrific team of writers that knew the game inside and out and didn't need a ton of edits certainly helped.

Harbour Town Golf Links, hands down. I was the sports editor at the Hilton Head Island Packet newspaper for 7 years or so in the 1990s, and got to cover the Heritage PGA Tour event each April and play Harbour Town a couple of times per year. I consider it Pete Dye's best work, and it's a tribute to his mastery that such a short course still challenges and confounds the world's best players, not to mention the Heritage's list of champions reads like a wall straight from the Golf Hall of Fame. One of the best sets of par 3s anywhere, and there's still nothing like standing on the 18th tee with the wind whipping, Calibogue Sound to your left and the iconic lighthouse straight ahead.

(Editor's note: We appreciate all the former employees who have contributed time and effort to this feature. The golf journalism community is a small one and we're proud of the achievements of all our former colleagues.)

This article originally appeared on Golfweek: Golfweek 50th anniversary memories: Longtime editor Kevin Adams

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed
description: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed.
fullText:
For the first time in four years, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander won't participate at NBA All-Star weekend. Once he was ruled out through the break with an abdominal strain, the reigning MVP's absence let out some air from the balloon in a three-day event that highlights the league's best players.

Alperen Sengun has replaced Gilgeous-Alexander as a 2026 NBA All-Star injury replacement. He will take his spot on Team World in the three-team round-robin tournament that replaces Sunday's traditional All-Star Game.

Sengun's NBA All-Star teammates are Nikola Jokic, Giannis Antetokounmpo, Luka Doncic, Victor Wembanyama, Karl-Anthony Towns, Jamal Murray, Deni Avdija and Pascal Siakam.

Sengun joins teammate Kevin Durant for the star-studded event. Both will represent the Houston Rockets. Just yesterday, the hospital Oklahoma City Thunder dropped a 112-106 loss to them. Sengun had a 17-point, 12-rebound and 11-assist triple-double.

The Thunder continue to voyage through Gilgeous-Alexander's absence. So far, they're 0-2 in a five-game stretch. Never ideal to be without your best player, but sacrificing five games for three weeks off is pretty economical.

The Thunder will still be part of the NBA All-Star weekend extravaganza. Chet Holmgren will be part of Team USA stars. His teammates are Anthony Edwards, Cade Cunningham, Devin Booker, Tyrese Maxey, Scottie Barnes, Jalen Johnson and Jalen Duren.

This article originally appeared on OKC Thunder Wire: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed

title: Wigan, Wakefield and Bradford advance in Challenge Cup
description: Wigan Warriors and Wakefield Trinity both score more than 80 points as fellow Super League sides Bradford Bulls and Catalan Dragons also reach round four.
fullText:
Wigan Warriors and Wakefield Trinity were both comfortable winners in the Challenge Cup third round, with two other Super League teams - Bradford Bulls and Catalans Dragons - also going through.

The Warriors scored 15 tries to beat the hapless Rochdale Hornets 83-0, while Trinity ran in one fewer in a 82-6 mauling of the Swinton Lions.

The Bulls secured their first win under new coach Kurt Haggerty, defeating London Broncos 26-8 at Plough Lane, and the Dragons scored 10 tries in a 56-4 demolition of Batley Bulldogs.

Goole Vikings, who were only formed in 2018, defeated fellow Championship side Halifax Panthers 18-14 at The Shay.

Tries from Nick Staveley, Oli Morgan and Keenen Tomlinson proved enough as the Panthers failed to score in the second half.

Zach Eckersley scored four tries and Jake Wardle three as the Warriors, last year's Super League runners-up, easily despatched the Hornets.

Wakefield showed no mercy in their victory either, with Max Jowitt, Matthew Storton and Josh Rourke sharing seven tries between them against the Lions.

Batley were overwhelmed by Catalans, conceding within the first 17 seconds before the visitors ran in a further nine tries.

Elsewhere, Oldham easily defeated Dewsbury Rams 46-0 and Keighley Cougars edged a low-scoring encounter against Midlands Hurricanes 18-14.

The draw for the fourth round will take place on Monday, 9 February, with live coverage on BBC Radio Manchester from 18:40 GMT.

title: Where you can watch the 2026 Super Bowl live today
description: Not sure where to watch the 2026 Super Bowl live? There are multiple ways to watch the game for free today. Here's how.
fullText:
The big game is finally here. In what many would argue is the biggest sporting event on the 2026 calendar, the New England Patriots are set to take on the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, today in Super Bowl 60.

Both teams enter the game with similar records, with the Patriots coming in at 17-3 and the Seahawks entering at 16-3 in what is an evenly matched contest between two of the NFL's superstar teams.

Do you have your snacks and drinks ready and just need to know where, exactly, to tune in (and at what time)? Below, we'll break down all of the information you need to know in order to watch today's big event and all of the entertainment before and after.

Catch the game on Peacock and watch it anywhere you want.

Where to watch the 2026 Super Bowl

There's no shortage of options to watch the 60th Super Bowl today. Viewers can catch the action on NBC on broadcast television, Telemundo or stream it from anywhere they wish via the Peacock app. Game day coverage will begin at 12:00 p.m. ET on NBC, the network says, with commentary, analysis and pre-game predictions interspersed throughout before the game kicks off at 6:30 p.m. ET on all of the same viewing options.

Catch all of the Super Bowl action on Peacock.

What channel will the Super Bowl air on?

All of the Super Bowl action will air on NBC, though the specific numbered channel will depend on your location, so check local listings if you're unsure. That said, you can stream it on Peacock or watch on Telemundo, too, so you'll have a variety of ways to catch the big game, the pre- and post-game analysis, and an exciting half-time show, too.

Can you watch the 2026 Super Bowl for free?

If you have a television that has NBC or Telemundo, then technically you can watch the Super Bowl for free, as has been the case for all of the previous Super Bowls. That said, the Peacock app will come with a minor subscription cost, but it could be worth paying for the flexibility it offers and the vast library of alternative entertainment options you'd be gaining access to in addition to the Super Bowl coverage.

Learn more about your Peacock subscription options here.

Can you stream the 2026 Super Bowl without cable?

You don't need a cable subscription to stream Peacock and, thus, watch the 2026 Super Bowl. While some cable providers may offer the service anyway, you can technically stream it without cable through a Roku, Fire TV Stick, smart TV or your preferred streaming device.

What time does the Super Bowl start airing?

The big game starts at 6:30 p.m. ET, though that can change by a few minutes either way. But with game day coverage beginning at 12:00 p.m. ET, there will be ample time to get ready without missing a minute of real-time action.

All the ways to watch the Super Bowl 2026

There's no shortage of ways to catch the action, analysis and entertainment today. Here's a recap of all the ways to watch the Super Bowl 2026:

Broadcast: Your local NBC channel will have coverage for most of the day and can be an easy way to tune in and out without having to switch services. Telemundo is also offering coverage for Spanish-speaking viewers.Streaming: Peacock is your go-to app for all of the Super Bowl coverage and action, and if you get bored with the pre-game analysis, you can always pivot out and watch one of the other programs in their vast library before kick-off.

title: Maddy McDaniel injury update, Dawn Staley down another player vs Tennessee
description: South Carolina women's basketball backup point guard Maddy McDaniel is out and won't play against Tennessee on Feb. 8.
fullText:
COLUMBIA â€” More injury news popped up for South Carolina women's basketball, this time right before tipoff in a top-20 matchup.

Sophomore point guard Maddy McDaniel was listed as out on the SEC injury report ahead of the game against No. 17 Tennessee at 3 p.m. ET on ABC.

McDaniel wasn't one of the three guards previously injured this week, as coach Dawn Staley had been dealing with limitations for Ta'Niya Latson, Agot Makeer and Tessa Johnson.

Only Makeer was listed as out for the No. 3 GamecocksÂ (23-2, 9-1 SEC) on the injury report published on Feb. 7, a positive sign with Johnson and Latson back but now Staley is down yet another guard.

Against a team like the Lady Vols (15-5, 7-1), guard play matters as they press a lot with a fast-paced tempo which means Raven Johnson will need help handling the ball.

The sophomore's minutes have increased as Staley hasn't had two of her three starting guards the last two full games.

McDaniel is averaging 4.5 points and three assists per game and has had a combined 17 points and nine assists over the last two.

Before Makeer went down in the first quarter of the win over Auburn on Jan. 29, she was starting in place of center Madina Okot.

Injuries are nothing new for this year's team, dating back to when star forward Chloe Kitts tore her ACL in September. South Carolina's Feb. 2 win over Texas A&M marked the sixth different starting lineup for Staley, then a seventh in the most recent game, a 88-45 win over Mississippi State on Feb. 5.

McDaniel was part of the starting lineup on Feb. 2 but didn't start on Feb. 5, instead freshman Ayla McDowell did.

Against Tennessee, Staley could keep the same starters from last game, especially if she wants to pound the paint inside with Joyce Edwards and Okot.

McDaniel wasn't immune to the early season injury trend, as she went down in the season opener with a knee injury then in the middle of recovering, was suspended. She missed four full games total.

Lulu Kesin covers South Carolina athletics for The Greenville News and the USA TODAY Network. Email her atÂ LKesin@usatodayco.com. Follow her on X@Lulukesin and Blueskyâ€ª@bylulukesin.bsky.socialâ€¬

title: ğŸ¯ Supply & demand; Inter defender proving to be their creative mastermind
description: Inter have once again shown why they are top of the Serie A table, and favourites for theÂ Scudetto.TheÂ Nerazzurri jumped out to a 2-0 lead against Sassuolo, with Inter defenderÂ Federico Dimarco pro...
fullText:
Inter have once again shown why they are top of the Serie A table, and favourites for theÂ Scudetto.

TheÂ Nerazzurri jumped out to a 2-0 lead against Sassuolo, with Inter defenderÂ Federico Dimarco providing both assists.

Inter opened the lead with a strong header from Yann Aurel Bisseck directly off of Dimarco's corner.

They increased their advantage in transition as Dimarco whipped in a low, firm cross to set-up a simple tap-in for Marcus Thuram.

With those two assists, the Italy international has now set a Serie A record for most assists (9) from a defender after 24 league matches played.

Following four wins in their previous five matches, Inter look poised to extend their lead at the top of the table to eight points, having played one match more than second-placed Milan.

title: What JJ Watt said about Harry Kaneâ€™s chances of making the NFL when he retires from football
description: Harry Kane has previously spoken about his interest in trying American football once his professional football career comes to an end. Those comments led to a discussion about whether such a move would be realistic for a player who has spent years at the top level of another sport.
fullText:
Harry Kane has previously spoken about his interest in trying American football once his professional football career comes to an end.

Those comments led to a discussion about whether such a move would be realistic for a player who has spent years at the top level of another sport.

Former NFL player JJ Watt was later asked for his view on the idea, sharing his perspective on Kaneâ€™s chances of making the transition.

Watt suggested the possibility should not be dismissed and explained why Kaneâ€™s background could be relevant.

When discussing Kaneâ€™s ambitions of becoming an NFL kicker, Watt pointed to the strikerâ€™s lifelong experience kicking a football.

He explained that this background would give Kane a strong base if he ever committed fully to an NFL pathway.

â€œI think with true proper dedicated training, I think Harry Kane could make it as an NFL kicker,â€ Watt said in 2024.

â€œI think that his skill set, obviously having kicked balls for his entire life, then you put him with a proper kicking trainer, itâ€™s going to go well.â€

Watt was also careful to acknowledge the difficulty of the role, despite liking Kaneâ€™s chances.

â€œI donâ€™t want to diminish the job of a kicker because itâ€™s an extremely difficult job,â€ he added.

â€œBut somebody that does it at the highest level like Harry has, with proper training, I do think heâ€™s good at it.â€

Watt also drew on a previous experience to explain why footballers can adapt to NFL kicking.

He recalled taking part in a field goal competition with Manchester City legend Sergio Aguero in the United States.

â€œI did a field goal competition with Sergio Aguero in America when Manchester City came over for a pre-season tour, and he was phenomenal, making 65-yard field goals,â€ Watt revealed.

He explained that the biggest challenge for footballers is adjusting to NFL timing and technique.

â€œThe only difference is that he would have taken a long run-up, whereas in the NFL, you get 1.2 seconds from the time the ball is snapped, so youâ€™ve got to take a two-step run-up and kick it, but he was pounding the ball through the upright.â€

Watt also added context when comparing Kane to the leagueâ€™s best.

â€œJustin Tucker is the best kicker in NFL history, so Iâ€™m not saying that Harry Kane can be that,â€ he continued.

â€œBut I do think that Harry could possibly, with three years of intensive everyday training, make an NFL roster, one of 32, because heâ€™s had to do it his whole life.

â€œAnd maybe a goalkeeper would probably be a better option because they have to do goal kicks.â€

Why Tom Brady was confused with Scottie Scheffler preferring to be a â€˜better fatherâ€™ than golfer

Sage Steele goes off at NFL for choosing â€˜anti-Americanâ€™ Bad Bunny for Super Bowl 60 halftime show

Why British NFL fans should be backing the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX

title: Sandro Tonali: Man United make major transfer decision on Newcastle midfielder
description: Manchester United are reportedly strongly considering a summer swoop for Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali.United eyeing midfield reinforcementsHaving spent the bulk of their summer transfer b...
fullText:
Manchester United are reportedly strongly considering a summer swoop for Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali.

Having spent the bulk of their summer transfer budget on bolstering their attacking department after a goal-shy 2024/25 campaign, United are now expected to shift their focus to make signings in midfield

Casemiroâ€™s announcement last month that he will leave when his contract expires has only heightened the urgency for United to find a new midfielder. There have been suggestions that the Red Devils could potentially sign more than one midfielder.

Some of the players that continue to be linked to United include Adam Wharton (Crystal Palace), Elliot Anderson (Nottingham Forest) and Carlos Baleba (Brighton and Hove Albion).

United attempted to lure Baleba to Old Trafford last summer and itâ€™s believed the Cameroonian was keen on the transfer.Â  However, a deal failed to get over the line due to Brightonâ€™s prohibitive asking price.

Now, The Telegraph report that Tonali is also of interest to United as the clubâ€™s midfield plans start to take shape.

According to the news outlet, â€œManchester United have put Sandro Tonali high on their shortlist ahead of the summer midfield rebuild at Old Trafford.â€

â€œThe Italy midfielder, 25, is expected to be at the heart of another transfer saga at Newcastle United after his agent revealed last week that his client is considering his future.â€

â€œUnited have confirmed that Casemiro will leave them in the summer at the end of his contract, leaving a hole in their midfield. Tonali is now firmly on their radar after his three seasons in the Premier League as they look at long-term options.â€

Mike McGrath notes that Juventus want to bring Tonali back to Serie A. In addition to United, Arsenal and Manchester City are also keeping tabs on the Newcastle manâ€™s situation.

Newcastle are said to be in line to make a significant profit on the Â£55m they paid AC Milan for Tonali in 2023.

Considering players like Enzo Fernandez, Moises Caicedo and Declan Rice all moved for more than Â£100m each, Newcastle are likely to demand a sum close to this for Tonali. It remains to be seen whether United would meet such a valuation.

Featured image Mike Hewitt via Getty Images

title: Abbey and St Patrick's level after MacRory thriller
description: Daniel Carr scores an injury-time equaliser to send a thrilling MacRory Cup final to a replay as Abbey CBS fight back for a 0-18 to 1-15 draw against St Patrick's, Dungannon.
fullText:
Daniel Carr popped up with an injury-time equaliser to send a thrilling MacRory Cup final to a replay as Abbey CBS fought back for a 0-18 to 1-15 draw against St Patrick's, Dungannon.

Leading by nine at half-time, the Tyrone school looked on course to make up for their disappointment at the final stage two years ago, but the Newry outfit flipped momentum in the second half as they live to fight another day.

The Newry side opened well with early scores from Diarmaid O'Rourke, but St Patrick's roared into it with a sixth-minute goal when Eoin Long was picked out by Liam McGeary to race through and finish low to the net.

While the Abbey levelled and the sides then swapped points, St Patrick's took over with the next nine points in a row.

Long began with the sequence with man of the match McGeary kicking five, Lorcan McMurray with a brace and Aodhan Quinn also in the act before the Abbey summoned a reply through Keelan McEntee.

Fergus Toale added another, but a two-pointer from St Patrick's captain Davin McKeown pushed the gap back to nine and after a late exchange of scores, the Dungannon side held a 1-13 to 0-7 lead at the break with Abbey denied a goal late in the half with Ronan Donnelly saving from Michael O'Neill.

It seemed they were well on their way, but two early scores from O'Rourke gave the Abbey a glimmer early in the second half.

Still, with St Patrick's scoring two of the next three that included McGeary's sixth from play, there was no hint of the drama that was to follow as the Abbey mounted a charge in the final quarter.

Daniel McKernan's followed up a fisted effort with a two-point free and when Keelan McEntee pointed, the gap was down to much more manageable four.

Abbey could have been closer, if not ahead, had some of their goal chances been converted with Fergus Toale firing wide and Daniel Carr was just off target from distance, but a McKernan score with five to go left three between them.

That gap ought to have been wiped out but for goal-line heroics by St Patrick's Ruairi O'Neill who thwarted Charlie McGrath and Odhran Reel, but momentum was with the Newry outfit as McGrath and Jack O'Mahoney brought the gap to one and then Carr completed the comeback deep in added time to force a replay on Friday, 13 February.

title: When was the last time the Seahawks made the Super Bowl?
description: Yep, it's the Super Bowl you're thinking of.
fullText:
After spending much of the first half of their existence as a forgettable also-ran, the 2000s have been considerably kinder to the Seattle Seahawks. After making the playoffs just five of their first seven seasons, Seattle has been a consistent presence in the postseason.

That hasn't led to a deluge of Super Bowl runs. In 50 seasons as a franchise, the Seahawks only have one Super Bowl win to show for it. It's a big one, however; a total dismantling of Peyton Manning and the Denver Broncos in Super Bowl 48, 43-8. That's not Seattle's most memorable big game performance however â€” and I'm not referring to the litany of officiating complaints that followed their 2006 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers.

The picture above lives on in sports bars across New England and in the nightmare of Seattle fans who just wanted Pete Carroll to run the dang ball. The Seahawks' last Super Bowl appearance was a dramatic 28-24 loss to the Patriots in Super Bowl 49 in February 2015. 11 years ago, Seattle faced second-and-goal with 26 seconds left. Rather than handing the ball to Marshawn Lynch, the All-Pro tailback who'd already rushed for more than 100 yards, Russell Wilson instead threw a quick slant undrafted rookie Malcolm Butler stepped in front of to effectively end the game.

This is the Seahawks' first season advancing beyond the Divisional Round since that devastating loss.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: When was the last time the Seahawks made the Super Bowl?

title: What are your Super Bowl predictions and hopes?

But for 30 teams, they have no other choice but to accept that a team that isnâ€™t theirs is going to win the Super Bowl. The Seahawks or the Patriots. Jared Verse spoke for many Rams [â€¦]
fullText:
Players and coaches obviously donâ€™t like rooting for any team to win the Super Bowl besides their own team. But for 30 teams, they have no other choice but to accept that a team that isnâ€™t theirs is going to win the Super Bowl.

title: NFL legend Randy Moss goes off on HOF voters after Bill Belichick snub
description: NFL legendary wide receiver Randy Moss didnâ€™t mince words when addressing Pro Football Hall of Fame voters snubbing his former coach, Bill Belichick, from the Hall. Belichickâ€™s name appeared on the ballot for the first time this year, but heâ€¦
fullText:
NFL legendary wide receiver Randy Moss didnâ€™t mince words when addressing Pro Football Hall of Fame voters snubbing his former coach, Bill Belichick, from the Hall. Belichickâ€™s name appeared on the ballot for the first time this year, but he will have to wait one more year to get inducted into the HOF.

The decision sparked plenty of reactions from former NFL players. Things got worse after New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft also didnâ€™t make it. During a Sunday appearance on ESPNâ€™s â€œNFL Countdown,â€ Moss sent a strong message to the voters and the people who put them there. He stated that if they werenâ€™t a player or a coach, they shouldnâ€™t have a say on who gets in.

â€œIâ€™m not gonâ€™ to really sit up here and just badmouth the Hall, â€™cause there are some guys that just got selected to this yearâ€™s Pro Football Hall of Fame that I do not want to take the light from,â€ Moss said. â€œBut one thing about not electing Robert Kraft, not electing Bill Belichick, the one thing that I would talk to all the voters. I really believe, as a football player, if you didnâ€™t play it, if you didnâ€™t coach it, you shouldnâ€™t have a vote. I donâ€™t care who you are, I donâ€™t care how you feel about it. Like I said, I donâ€™t wanna take no shine away from the guys elected today, and thatâ€™s it for me.â€

"If you didn't play it, if you didn't coach it, you shouldn't have a vote."

â€”@RandyMoss on Hall of Fame voting after Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected

â€” NFL on ESPN (@ESPNNFL) February 8, 2026

Randy Moss was inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2018, following a terrific career as one of the greatest wide receivers the game has ever seen. Eight years later, Belichick had the chance to join him in the Hall, but things didnâ€™t go as expected.

Moss wasnâ€™t the only legend who thought former players and coaches should be the ones voting, not writers and journalists. On Friday, he told Kevin Clark on â€œThis is Footballâ€ that only people already in the Hall of Fame should allow or deny entrance to candidates.

â€œI wouldnâ€™t want the grinch who stole Christmas voting on a beauty pageant,â€ Sanders said.

Deion Sanders believes only Hall of Famers should vote on the Hall of Fame. 

"I wouldnt want the grinch who stole Christmas voting on a beauty pageant. "

I said I think writers do a good job following the league.

"No, they don't" -Coach Prime.

Incredible This Is Football pic.twitter.com/wIUcIGXeDk

â€” Kevin Clark (@bykevinclark) February 6, 2026

The Belichick situation could result in major changes in the voting process.

title: Alejandro Garnacho unhappy with Â£25m Chelsea teammate even as Wolves seal victory
description: Liam Rosenior saw his side cruise to a 3-1 win over Wolves on Saturday, and while Chelsea never looked troubled, the result did not come without its concerns for the manager. Two Cole Palmer penalties and a well-taken third from the forward sealed the points for Chelsea, helping them tighten their grip on fifth place with a four-point cushion ahead of Liverpoolâ€™s clash with Man City.
fullText:
Liam Rosenior saw his side cruise to a 3-1 win over Wolves on Saturday, and while Chelsea never looked troubled, the result did not come without its concerns for the manager.

Two Cole Palmer penalties and a well-taken third from the forward sealed the points for Chelsea, helping them tighten their grip on fifth place with a four-point cushion ahead of Liverpoolâ€™s clash with Man City.

It also marked Roseniorâ€™s fourth straight Premier League victory since taking charge. He is just the first English manager to start his tenure that way since Craig Shakespeare in 2017 and the first at Chelsea since Maurizio Sarri.

However, the 41-year-old manager was not entirely pleased. He pointed to how Chelsea still had not put together a full 90-minute performance under him. Nine games into his tenure, he still feels that consistency is missing. There was also an attitude issue from one of his players that caught his eye.

This is a young Chelsea side, and the desire to impress has sometimes led to moments of frustration. It is a team full of self-belief, with plenty of players sure they deserve to be starting.

Alejandro Garnacho is a good example of that. The Argentine, brought in for Â£40m last summer, has not yet fully justified the fee, but there have been signs since Rosenior took over that he can make an impact.

His performance against Pafos stood out for how well he pressed and competed â€“ exactly what the British manager wants from his team. And the two goals against Arsenal showed he has the ability to finish as well.

But there have been difficult spells too. He struggled in Roseniorâ€™s first game and often looked frustrated, later taken off at half-time during the win over West Ham last month.

In that context, Kieran Gill reported for The Mail that Garnacho came off the bench on Saturday and was frustrated with Â£25m goalkeeper Robert Sanchez for not releasing him quickly enough on the counter-attack.

With Garnacho, there is often a sense that he has focused more on his own game than on what the team needs. On Saturday, Chelsea should have been slowing things down and taking the sting out of Wolvesâ€™ momentum, not playing into their hands.

Wolves had just scored before the hour mark and the home crowd were really getting behind them. Chelsea needed to slow things down, keep possession, waste a bit of time and manage the game better.

Sanchez was doing exactly that, while Garnacho seemed more concerned with chasing his own stats. It is worth noting that the Argentine winger is still young, but he also has plenty of experience already â€“ even if he remains a bit unpolished.

If Garnacho wants to impress Rosenior and push for a regular spot in the starting line-up, he needs to start focusing on what the team requires rather than his own agenda. Until then, it is hard to see him being anything more than an option off the bench.

title: Packers rumor involving $48 million pending free agent should interest Steelers, Raiders, Titans
description: A Green Bay Packers rumor involving a pending free agent wide receiver should interest the Pittsburgh Steelers, Tennessee Titans, and Las Vegas Raiders.
fullText:
Packers rumor involving $48 million pending free agent should interest Steelers, Raiders, Titans originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Green Bay Packers have a few key players set to hit the free agency market this offseason, one being wide receiver Romeo Doubs.

Doubs is coming off one of the best years of his career in 2025, tallying 724 yards and six touchdowns, and the Packers should look to bring him back. However, Green Bay will have some competition if they let the young receiver hit the market.

According to ESPN's Jeremy Fowler, Doubs and the Packers are expected to discuss an extension and pursue a return if it makes sense.

"The door isn't closed on Doubs in Green Bay. I'm expecting both sides to at least have some dialogue and see if a return makes sense," Fowler said.

However, Fowler also adds that there will be receiver-needy teams, such as the Tennessee Titans and Las Vegas Raiders, who could target Doubs and make him a very rich man.

"The Raiders and Titans will have my attention for free agent receivers. Both desperately need a difference-maker on the outside," Fowler added.

Las Vegas and Tennessee are slated to have the most cap space in the NFL this offseason, so both franchises have the money to lure Doubs away from Green Bay in free agency.

The Pittsburgh Steelers could also be in the Doubs market, especially due to his connection with quarterback Aaron Rodgers, who could return as the Steelers' starting signal-caller next season. A receiver duo of DK Metcalf and Doubs would be incredibly exciting for Pittsburgh.

Spotrac projects Doubs will land a four-year deal worth $48 million, an average annual value of $12 million. That would be a fair deal for Doubs, given the state of the receiver market and his youth.

We'll see if the Packers can get something done with Doubs, or if he'll be wearing a new uniform in 2026.

title: Lindsey Vonn crash updates: Latest news after USA ski star falls badly in Olympics women's downhill
description: Lindsey Vonn fell heavily early on in her Women's Downhill run on Sunday.
fullText:
Lindsey Vonn crash updates: Latest news after USA ski star falls badly in Olympics women's downhill originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Lindsey Vonn's bid to defy the odds and win a medal in her likely fifth and final Winter Olympics ended in awful scenes as she crashed early in her Women's Downhill run on Sunday.

Vonn was already a terrific story by making a post-knee surgery comeback into competitive skiing. Then, she tore her ACL in a crash days before the Olympics, only to confirm she planned to compete anyway.

MORE 2026 OLYMPICS: Live medal tracker | Viewer's guide | Day-by-day schedule

The 41-year-old lined up for her first medal shot in the Women's Downhill on Sunday, having clocked the third fastest time in her second raining run on Saturday.

Running 13th in the order, Vonn made a confident start but clipped a flag with her right shoulder and fell heavily. She was audibly distressed as she received medical attention before a helicopter arrived to carry her off the slope, as is customary when competitors are injured.

The Sporting News is tracking the latest updates.

MORE:Doctors explain why Lindsey Vonn was able to compete with torn ACL

Vonn was airborn as her right arm got caught in between the posts of a marker flag. She then lost her balance and hit the snow hard. She rolled over multiple times before coming to a stop on her back.

The 2010 Olympic champion could be heard crying out in distress as medical staff attended her on the slope. The BBC reporter and former Olympian,Â Chemmy Alcott, said background music had to be played to the stunned crowd because it was "uncomfortable" for spectators watching on.

Compatriot Breezy Johnson, who had set the fastest time, was in tears as she watched on from the paddock near the finish line. Johnson was later confirmed as Olympic champion.

The following brief statement was offered by the U.S. Ski and Snowboard team: "Lindsey Vonn fell in the Olympic downhill and will be evaluated by medical staff."

Later on Sunday, the U.S. Ski team released an updated statement that Vonn did in fact sustain an injury during her crash, but that she is in stable condition:

Update: Lindsey Vonn sustained an injury, but is in stable condition and in good hands with a team of American and Italian physicians.

â€” U.S. Ski & Snowboard Team (@usskiteam) February 8, 2026

Vonn was eventually airlifted off the slope by a helicopter, at which point she received a standing ovation. The competition was delayed by more than 10 minutes while Vonn was treated.

On Sunday afternoon, CBC reported that Vonn had suffered a fracture in her left leg, the same leg she tore her ACL on. The outlet adds that Vonn is being monitored in the ICU:

CBCâ€™s Brian Stemmle gives an update on Lindsey Vonnâ€™s condition after crashing at #MilanoCortina2026

According to Reuters, Vonn had surgery on a left leg fracture and is being monitored in the ICU https://t.co/9v9kpQjArMpic.twitter.com/QtrZjw522h

â€” CBC Olympics (@CBCOlympics) February 8, 2026

Vonn was taken to a hospital in Treviso, Italy per CBC. According to the BBC, the doctor who performed Vonn's knee surgery travelled in the helicopter.

Graham Bell, a five-time Olympic skier, said: "I had Vonn down for a medal. I would have done the exact same thing in Vonn's position, I would have raced.

"It can be done, she was doing it, she was fast in training, she took the risk and it didn't pay off."

Austrian skierÂ Nina Ortlieb also crashed in her run, although she was able to land safely and proceed to the finish line.Â Cande Moreno then fell heavily at the top of the course and appeared to have badly hurt her knee.

Lindsey Vonn saw promising results in her two practice runs, but she suffered a brutal crash early in her run on Sunday and had to be airlifted via helicopter for medical attention.

ğŸš¨ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ American Olympic skier Lindsey Vonn airlifted by helicopter after crashing in downhill skiing.

Vonn came out of retirement to compete again at 41. Now this.@RapidReport2025https://t.co/4v1rE4HCQfpic.twitter.com/CXxWBApdcU

â€” Mario Nawfal (@MarioNawfal) February 8, 2026

Vonn went airborne shortly after clipping a gate, which sent her airborne. The Associated Press captured a photo shortly after it happened:

The AP's Jacquelyn Martin has the photo that shows the split-second before Lindsey Vonn's crash: her right ski pole clips the gate at the crest of the jump, which flung her off balance and induced the crash. pic.twitter.com/RKjQ4H4lKg

â€” Matt Norlander (@MattNorlander) February 8, 2026

Lindsey Vonn's sister, Karin Kildow, reacted to the crash moments after it happened. She told NBC Sports that while it was hard to see, she knew that Lindsey would give it 110 percent.

The Sporting News will continue to monitor and update as more information becomes available.

title: Sam Darnold High School Highlights: Seahawks QB before NFL stardom
description: Sam Darnold has been facing challenges all throughout his time playing football since his days at San Clemente (Calif.). Now the former California high school football star will get his chance on the grandest stage of them all, Super Bowl LX, to show why heâ€™s one of the best to have ever come out of [â€¦]
fullText:
Sam Darnold has been facing challenges all throughout his time playing football since his days at San Clemente (Calif.). Now the former California high school football star will get his chance on the grandest stage of them all, Super Bowl LX, to show why heâ€™s one of the best to have ever come out of the Golden State.

Through Darnoldâ€™s sophomore and junior seasons with the Tritons, the Super Bowl starting quarterback had seen minimal time on the field at San Clemente, totaling 748 yards and seven touchdowns. It would be Darnoldâ€™s senior year where the signal caller would blossom into his own before heading off to become a USC Trojan.

During his senior campaign with the Tritons, Darnold had himself a strong season and ended up completing 213-of-314 passes for 2,985 yards and 39 touchdowns. The four-star prospect showed off his wheels on the ground, rushing for 785 yards and 13 touchdowns.

After his high school playing days at San Clemente, Darnold was already committed to USC, making his decision during the summer of 2014 heading into his senior season and would head into a crowded quarterback room with the Trojans.

Playing two seasons at USC with a redshirt freshman campaign, the 6-foot-3, 221-pound passer completing 549-of-846 passes for 7,229 yards and 57 touchdowns before being selected as the No. 3 pick of the 2018 NFL Draft by the New York Jets.

Now heading into Sundayâ€™s Super Bowl matchup with the six-time Super Bowl champion New England Patriots, Darnold has a chance one more time to prove the naysayers wrong and overcoming one more challenge in his path.

â€œSam Darnold was sort of a late bloomer (in high school). USC had their quarterback room all set and it was gonna go from (Cody) Kessler to Ricky Town. A lot of schools early on wanted Sam to play tight end. The issue at that time he wasnâ€™t doing a lot of camps or 7-on-7. First time I saw him at Mission Viejo 7-on-7 tournament and he was outstanding. He made all the the grows and was superb. The way his recruitment went, he to a camp at USC and Clay Helton was the HC at the time. The staff said they had to go after him at the time after seeing him. Oregon, Duke were also after him during the recruitment him. Darnold and his dad went to a lot of USC games. I think thatâ€™s a testament to his fortitude. Is it surprising, certainly. Just knowing him and his HC. Knowing heâ€™s a tough kid. He was walking into a very tough QB at USC and he stayed resilient.â€ â€“ Rivals National Recruiting reporter Adam Gorney

San Clemente High School, located in the coastal town of San Clemente, California, serves around 3,000 students from the city and surrounding areas, including Capistrano Beach and San Juan Capistrano. Established in 1964, the school is part of the Capistrano Unified School District and boasts a robust athletics program with a strong community presence under the motto â€œOne Town, One Team.â€ The Tritons are recognized for their competitive spirit across various sports disciplines.

For California high school football fans looking to keep up with scores around the nation, staying updated on the action is now easier than ever with theÂ Rivals High School Scoreboard. This comprehensive resource provides real-time updates and final scores from across the Golden State, ensuring you never miss a moment of the Friday night frenzy. From nail-biting finishes to dominant performances, the Rivals High School Scoreboard is your one-stop destination for tracking all the high school football excitement across the state of California.

title: MSU's Jeremy Fears Jr. adds another elite effort to quiet detractors
description: Despite distractions and controversies, Jeremy Fears Jr. delivers again for Michigan State basketball at a historic level in OT win over Illinois.
fullText:
EAST LANSING â€” Jeremy Fears Jr. has elevated his game over the past six weeks to an All-American level, regardless of the chastising and consternation around him.

Fears' play may even be among the best in Michigan State basketball history by the time the season ends.

Tom Izzo watched his point guard once again take over and dominate after halftime Saturday, Feb. 7, against No. 6 Illinois. Fears scored 11 of the 10th-ranked Spartansâ€™ 14 points in overtime and finished with 26 points and 15 assists against two turnovers in a come-from-behind 85-82 victory at Breslin Center.

â€œI felt bad â€“ that hurt me, and I was hurting my team,â€ Fears said of the on-court controversy that started eight days earlier with a loss to Michigan. â€œBut at the end of the day, without the team, coach Izzo, the coaches, their support and belief in me kept me grounded. Understanding that I need the team, the team needs me. And it just was a bonding moment, I think. It just brought us closer.

â€œIt was just a distraction we didnâ€™t need. And just being able to come out here and get this win was special.â€

The 6-foot-2, 190-pound redshirt sophomore from Joliet, Illinois, entered Sunday ranked fourth in the KenPom.com national player of the year standings. Fears trails Duke's Cameron Boozer, Iowa State's Joshua Jefferson and Houston's Kingston Flemings.

Against the Illini, Fears either scored or assisted on 22 of MSU's 29 made shots â€“ almost 76%. He also had a hand in 62 of his teamâ€™s 85 points, including going 12-for-13 on free throws. His 15 assists rank fourth-most in a game by a Spartan, along with directing MSU to a 22-0 advantage in fastbreak points over Illinois (20-4, 11-2 Big Ten).

Fears made all seven of his free throws in overtime, though he was 7-for-19 shooting from the field in the game while playing a career-high 42 minutes, 30 seconds. It was his fifth time scoring at least 20 points this season and 10th time with at least 10 assists.

â€œI think now, heâ€™s understanding the level of leadership and level of maturity he needs to have,â€ senior Carson Cooper said. â€œToday, there was a lot of times where he couldâ€™ve got ahead of himself, he couldâ€™ve gotten in his head, he could've been doing extra stuff. And being able to pull this out and have the game he had is huge for him.â€

According to CBBAnalytics.com, Fears became the first major conference (Big Ten, SEC, Big 12, ACC, Big East) player since Trae Young in Dec. 19, 2017 to post 25-or-more points with 15-or-more assists in a game. Young had 26 points and 22 assists for Oklahoma in a nonconference win over Northwestern State.

Fears, however, did it against the No. 6 team in the country. In a Big Ten game. Against his home state rival. On national television. After a week of heightened scrutiny and debate over whether he is a gritty or dirty player.

â€œDid he need it to validate? No. Did I need it for him to validate? No. No, guys, I don't need that, I could give a damn about that,â€ Izzo said. â€œI just was pleased that most of the time I spent the last four or five days was talking with him, because you go one of two ways when there's distractions. You want to mete it (out) and prove something â€“ he was not in that mode at all â€“ or you just do your job and you take care of your business.â€

In Fearsâ€™ past 12 games, he is averaging 19.5 points, 9.1 assists, 2.3 rebounds and 1.2 steals. Heâ€™s shooting 91.4% at the free-throw line, going 85-for-93, and connecting on 57.5% of his 2-point shots.

While Izzo attempted to temper praise for Fears, who is shooting just 21.4% from 3-point range during that stretch, the Hall of Fame coach and his other players also know they can only reach their ceiling and beyond behind their No. 1 engine.

â€œObviously, itâ€™s been tough for Jeremy,â€ Cooper said. â€œWe had to have a lot of heart-to-hearts. After Minnesota, me and Jeremy had a one-on-one a while, about 45 minutes or an hour. I needed to clear stuff up with him and kind of see where his brain was at. â€¦

â€œOne of the biggest things I told him is Jeremy Fears is the key to all our success.â€

But it didnâ€™t come without another controversy after a week-plus of them.

With 3:23 left in Saturdayâ€™s first half, Fears was leading the Spartans in transition when he stuck his left leg out slightly and tangled his feet with Illinoisâ€™ David MirkoviÄ‡, who tripped and fell to the floor. Illini coach Brad Underwood appealed for a review a few seconds later, but no penalty was assessed by referee Jeff Anderson.

â€œObviously, I understand that everything will be magnified,â€ Fears said. â€œSo just for me, itâ€™s not even trying to get put in a position like that. Overall, I know whatâ€™s a basketball play. I wasnâ€™t trying to trip or harm anyone. â€¦ Itâ€™s just understanding that everything will be kind of looked at now. Itâ€™s nothing I can really control â€“ just go out there and play ball.â€

Jeremy Fears Jr with another trip? pic.twitter.com/nMovtrrsR9

â€” The Field of 68 (@TheFieldOf68) February 8, 2026

Fearsâ€™ 26 points were his third-most in his career, trailing only the 31 he scored in a Jan. 30 home loss to No. 2 Michigan, and the 29 he scored on Jan. 27 at Rutgers. It also was his 12th straight game scoring in double figures.

Saturdayâ€™s second half and overtime takeover was reminiscent of the victory over the Scarlet Knights, in which Fears scored 27 points after half.

In both games, Fears attacked off the dribble and either hit a bucket in the paint or got fouled and scored at the free-throw line.

â€œSecond half, he did what he had to do,â€ Izzo said, â€œwhich great players do in winning time. He found a way to make some key plays.â€

Fears leads the nation in assists per game at 9.1 (219 in 24 games), while Purdue's Braden Smith is second at 8.7 (200 in 23 games). They are the only two players in the country averaging more than eight assists.

No MSU player in history â€“ not even Magic Johnson â€“ has averaged more than nine assists over a full season. Johnson's 8.4 a game in the Spartans' 1978-79 national championship run is the most, and the only time a Spartan has even eclipsed eight.

Also according to KenPom.com, Fears leads the nation in assist rate, assisting on 53.5% of his teammates' baskets while on the floor. Mateen Cleavesâ€™ school record 20 assists is seemingly within Fearsâ€™ reach on any given night. With the help of his teammates, of course.

And they gave him plenty Saturday in a thrilling win that keeps MSU (20-4, 10-3) afloat in the hunt to repeat as Big Ten champ.

Six of Fearsâ€™ assists against Illinois came on 3-pointers by the Spartans, who made seven in the game. The lone non-Fears assist came from a kickout dish from Jaxon Kohler to Kur Teng for a go-ahead 3-pointer with 8.6 seconds left in regulation.

Kohler posted his first double-double to end a six-game drought, finishing with 11 points and 16 rebounds that equaled his most boards in a Big Ten game in his career. Cooper, Coen Carr and Cam Ward combined to add 23 rebounds as the Spartans outrebounded Illinois, 48-38 and 7-2 in overtime.

Carr (eight points, eight rebounds) delivered an electric reverse dunk on a Fears alley-oop, one of three times the two connected to get Breslin buzzing. Fears also hit Cooper (nine points, eight rebounds) for another dunk. Shooting guards Jordan Scott and Teng each scored 10 points, with reserve Trey Fort hitting his only shot, a 3-pointer.

Defensively, Scott took the bulk of the time on fellow freshman Wagler, with Fears and Cooper also providing some of the different looks that flummoxed the Illini star. Wagler went just 2-for-16 from the field, finishing with 16 points and six rebounds along with just three assists.

â€œWithout them doing their jobs,â€ Fears said of his teammates, â€œwe probably more than likely donâ€™t get the win. â€¦ Everybody just did what we needed to do, and thatâ€™s what we werenâ€™t doing the last two games.â€

After ending a two-game losing streak, closing a stretch of four games in 12 days, the Spartans next play Friday at Wisconsin (8 p.m., Fox). And despite losing shooting guard Divine Ugochukwu for the season to a broken left foot, Izzo savored what he saw Saturday, and knows the Spartans must build on it over the final seven games of the regular season.

â€œWe needed the win," Izzo said. "We needed to play like Michigan State. We needed to rebound, run. We needed to get back to what we do. Are we over a hump? Hell, no. The next game, it gets tougher.â€

Contact Chris Solari: csolari@freepress.com. Follow himÂ @chrissolari.

title: Team USA Olympic hockey lines take shape before first game
description: It's almost time for the action.
fullText:
Team USA Olympic hockey lines take shape before first game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The United State men's hockey team took the ice Sunday for their first practice together in Italy before Winter Olympics competition gets underway.

That allowed fans to begin to get a look at what the lines might look like when action actually gets going with the U.S. in pursuit of a gold medal.

In early proceedings, the first two lines took a real shape, while the rest of the forwards mixed in with various arrangements.

The Athletic's Michael Russo provided these insights from watching the initial practice.

The first line shapes up to be centered by Auston Matthews. Jake Guentzel was on his left wing, and Matt Boldy on the right.

MORE:Â The Olympics reason Ilia Malinin doesn't have a girlfriend

The second line has Jack Eichel sandwiched by a pair of Tkachuk brothers, Brady on the left and Matthew on the right.

Russo also reported on what the initial defenseman pairings looked like.

Quinn Hughes and Charlie McAvoy are slated to be the top blue-line pairing.

Behind them, it looks like Justin Slavin and Brock Faber will be a pairing.

Zach Werenski and Noah Hanifin were working together, too.

That left Jake Sanderson to work with Jackson LaCombe (who was the injury replacement for Seth Jones).

The first game for the United States will be on Thursday against Latvia, with group games against Denmark and Germany to follow.

title: Lindsey Vonn â€˜Stableâ€™ After Downhill Final Crash, Breezy Johnson Wins Team USAâ€™s First Gold
description: Lindsey Vonn, one of the most accomplished female skiers of all time, is in stable condition after she crashed 13 seconds into her downhill run on Sunday in Italy. Teammate Breezy Johnson took home the gold medal in the event.
fullText:
Lindsey Vonn, one of the most accomplished female skiers of all time, is in stable condition after she crashed 13 seconds into her downhill run on Sunday in Italy. Teammate Breezy Johnson took home the gold medal in the event.

Vonn was intent on a comeback in the Olimpia delle Tofane downhill race and was skiing with a fully torn ACL. Several authorities have stressed the crash was not the result of her knee injury.

Vonn hooked her right arm and shoulder around the courseâ€™s fourth gate, which forced her entire body to the right as she jumped. She spun in the air and landed hard on the snow before she fell down the slope.

The 41-year-old skierâ€™s comeback attempt was already legendary: Vonn came out of retirement and bounced back from the ACL tear. She was ultimately airlifted off the course and treated by staff who have since described her condition as â€œstable.â€

Update: Lindsey Vonn sustained an injury, but is in stable condition and in good hands with a team of American and Italian physicians.

â€” U.S. Ski & Snowboard Team (@usskiteam) February 8, 2026

â€œLindsey Vonn sustained an injury, but is in stable condition and in good hands with a team of American and Italian physicians,â€ the US Ski & Snowboard Team said in a short statement on social media.

Johnsonâ€™s gold medal win comes four years after she crashed on the same course and was stopped from competing in the 2022 Winter Games. The medal was a first for Johnson and the first gold for Team USA at the 2026 Olympic Games.

â€œI thought todayâ€™s race was going to be the most competitive alpine ski race that has ever taken place,â€ Johnson said. â€œThe girls here love this course. The sun was out. It was perfect conditions on the Tofane track. And I knew that the margins were going to be fine. Hundredths matter.â€

Johnson will compete again Tuesday in the team combined event.

â€œHer coach said she was cheering for me in the helicopter,â€ Johnson said of Vonn after the race. â€œI hope for the best for her. I hope itâ€™s not too bad. My heart aches for her.â€

title: Nate Oats silences Auburn fans amid Charles Bediako playing
description: The Tide coach came out swinging.
fullText:
Nate Oats silences Auburn fans amid Charles Bediako playing originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Nate Oats brought on the silence and enjoyed every minute of it.

The Alabama head coach fired back at Auburn fans Saturday night after the Crimson Tide left Neville Arena with a 96-92 road win on Saturday. He quieted a crowd that spent much of the game heckling former Tigers standout Aden Holloway and NBA bounce back Charles Bediako.

â€œCharles took a little bit off him today,â€ Oats said. â€œGood teammates. I think heâ€™s fine. He knew it was coming. Thatâ€™s what they do. But they were pretty quiet when we left.â€

Hollowayâ€™s return to Neville Arena carried extra emotion after his transfer across the state, though much of the crowdâ€™s attention centered on Bediako and his ongoing eligibility court case. Oats noted that results speak louder than taunts.

â€œBest way to quiet them is to win on the scoreboard,â€ he said. â€œThey were quiet last year, they were quiet this year. Heâ€™s 2-0 coming back here.â€

Holloway backed it up with 15 points in 31 minutes, highlighted by a four-point play from the corner and a tough left-handed floater that helped stretch Alabamaâ€™s lead. Bediako added 12 points and three rebounds off the bench, providing a steady interior presence.

More: Former UNC player admits to punching Duke player: 'Thats free licksâ€™

Even Auburn coach Steven Pearl acknowledged Bediakoâ€™s impact postgame. But yet another subdued exit from Auburnâ€™s home floor.

For now, the former NBA player fights to keep his eligibility claim alive in court. Whether or not he remains on the court is in the hand of an Alabama judge.
